meanings.definition: The people living in a particular country or area.
meanings.sent1: The populace gathered in the town square for the annual festival.
meanings.sent2: The entire populace of the city was excited about the new park opening.
meanings.sent3: The populace decided to have a dance-off to determine the best dancer in town.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the bustling streets transformed into a sea of the populace.
meanings.sent5: The marketplace was filled with the vibrant colors of the populace's clothing.

meanings.sent1: The local populace enjoyed the outdoor concert in the park.
meanings.sent2: The movie premiere attracted a large populace eager to see the film.
meanings.sent3: The populace cheered loudly as the magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech resonated with the entire populace, inspiring hope for change.
meanings.sent5: The bookstore was a popular spot for the reading populace to gather and discuss books.
